'Butanone', also known as 'methyl ethyl ketone' or 'MEK', is an organic compound
with the formula CH 3C(O)CH 2CH 3. This colorless
liquid ketone has a sharp, sweet odor reminiscent of butterscotch and acetone.
It is produced industrially on a large scale, and also occurs in trace amounts
in nature. Wilhelm Neier, Guenter Strehlke "2-Butanone" in in
Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Wiley-VCH, Weinheim, 2002.
It is soluble in water and is commonly used as an industrial solvent.
